thread.title: No love lost when Fort Lewis soccer plays No. 8 Colorado Mines
thread.title_full: No love lost when Fort Lewis soccer plays No. 8 Colorado Mines

title: No love lost when Fort Lewis soccer plays No. 8 Colorado Mines
text: No love lost when Fort Lewis soccer plays No. 8 Colorado Mines Tweet Steve Lewis/Durango Herald Fort Lewis College true freshman Martin Lopez has wasted no time getting acclimated to NCAA Division II men’s soccer after coming to Durango with twin brother Andres. Both players have two goals this season, but they’ll face their biggest test to date against No. 8 and bitter rival Colorado Mines at 3 p.m. Friday at Dirks Field on the FLC campus. Steve Lewis/Durango Herald Fort Lewis College true freshman Martin Lopez has wasted no time getting acclimated to NCAA Division II men’s soccer after coming to Durango with twin brother Andres. Both players have two goals this season, but they’ll face their biggest test to date against No. 8 and bitter rival Colorado Mines at 3 p.m. Friday at Dirks Field on the FLC campus. Tweet Steve Lewis/Durango Herald Few players know how to energize the crowd better than Fort Lewis College junior Tamino Kroeger, who has four goals this season. And no opponent excites the rowdy fans at Dirks Field quite like Colorado Mines, who will enter the game Friday ranked No. 8 in Division II. Steve Lewis/Durango Herald Few players know how to energize the crowd better than Fort Lewis College junior Tamino Kroeger, who has four goals this season. And no opponent excites the rowdy fans at Dirks Field quite like Colorado Mines, who will enter the game Friday ranked No. 8 in Division II.
